doc.after: Initial-fricative-voicing is a process that occurs in the West Country accents where the fricatives /s/, /f/, /Î¸/, /Ê/ and /h/ can be voiced to [z], [v], [Ã°], [Ê] and [É¦] when they occur at the beginning of a word.
